facts: Employee claims employer violated the Fair Labor Standards Act
Both parties are citizens of the same state
Lawsuit filed in federal district court
asp_facts: claim(c1). claim_type(c1, subject_matter_jurisdiction). plaintiff(c1, employee). defendant(c1, employer). federal_question(c1, yes). federal_statute(c1, flsa). diversity_jurisdiction(c1, no). same_state_citizens(c1, yes). amount_in_controversy(c1, 5000).
question: Does the federal court have subject matter jurisdiction?
rationale: Federal courts have subject matter jurisdiction over claims arising under federal law (federal question jurisdiction). The FLSA claim arises under federal law, so federal court has jurisdiction regardless of diversity or amount in controversy.
